Information Propagation "Chinese Character Encoding Set
1 This standard specifies the Chinese graphic characters and their binary codes in hexadecimal notation for use in information technology.
This document applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output of Chinese and other text, graphics, and character information.

This specification is applicable to technical products that have information processing and exchange functions for Chinese and other text graphics characters, including but not limited to software products represented by input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, speech synthesis, text-to-speech, handwriting recognition, and electronic books and readers, as well as portable products represented by computers, communication terminals, electronic book readers, and learning machines.
2 normative reference documents
The following documents are referenced in this document and are indispensable for its application.
For dated references, only the edition dated as stated applies; for undated references, the latest edition of that publication applies.
GB2312.1-1980 “Information Exchange Using Chinese Character Coding Character Set” Basic Set
GB11383-1989 Information processing "Information interchange -- Coded character set structure and encoding rules
GB13000 Information technology — Universal character set (UCS)

4.1 General remarks
The characters in this file are encoded as single bytes, double bytes, or quad bytes.
The single byte part contains all 128 characters of GB11383-1989 from 0x00 to 0x7F.
4.3 Two-Byte Characters
The double-byte part includes all the graphic characters in GB2312.1-1980 and the CJK unified ideographs and some graphic characters in GB13000.
characters in double @-@ byte sequences are encoded according to the rules in Annex A.
for which the semantic descriptor is a graphical symbol, the location and function of the code point must conform to the requirements of Appendix B.
Note GB13000 is a unified encoding for Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Vietnam, and other countries and regions.
Unique abstract characters are assigned unique code points, while characters with the same abstract form but different origins are assigned shared code points.
Coded Han characters are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK stands for China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4 Four-byte Part

The four-byte section includes the 66 CJK Unified Ideographs (U+9FA6 to U+9FEF, excluding the 8 characters U+9FB4 to U+9FBB) and CJK Unified Ideographs Extension A, CJK Unified Ideographs Extension B, CJK Unified Ideographs Extension C, CJK Unified Ideographs Extension D, CJK Unified
characters in four @-@ byte parts are encoded as specified in Annex C.
5 Overall Structure
In the text, numbers preceded by 0x are in hexadecimal, and numbers not preceded by 0x are in decimal.
all encodings are represented in hexadecimal in the appendix , and all other numbers are represented in decimal .
The single byte part uses the encoding structure of GB11383-1989, using the code bits 0x00~0x7F.

The double-byte characters are represented by two eight-bit binary digits, and the first byte code bit starts from 0x81 and ends with 0xFE, and the last byte code bit is 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
The four-byte part uses GB11383.1-1989, which does not use 0x30-0x39 as a suffix for the double-byte code extension, and the code range is 0x81308130-0xFE39FE39.

The first character of a four-byte character is encoded in the range 0x81 to 0xFE; the second character is encoded in the range 0x30 to 0x39; the third character is encoded in the range 0x81 to 0xFE; the fourth character is encoded in the range 0x30 to 0x39. That is: 0x81308130 to 0

This document defines three levels of achievement.

System software products that are compliant with the corresponding implementation level should provide input/output functionality for all characters within the corresponding implementation level range.
9.2. Implementation Level 1

Implement level 1 word file encoding part, double season encoding part and four-byte encoding part of CJK Unified Ideograph (i.e. 0x82358F33 one 0x82359636) and CJK Unified Ideograph Extensions A (i.e. 0x8139EE39 one 0x82358738).
Any product to which this document applies shall meet the requirements for level 1.
Note: Level 1 may also be implemented to support any of the non-Chinese scripts listed in Table 3.
9.3 Level 2 Implementation
level 2 includes level 1.
In addition, level 2 realizes the encoding of Chinese characters that are not included in the level 1 realizations of the General Standard Chinese Character Table.
The codes and glyphs of the Hanzi collected in the General Standard Chinese Characters Table are listed in Appendix.
system software and support software shall meet the requirements of level 2.

Note: System software and application software include but are not limited to operating systems, database management systems, middleware (for information on software product classification, see GB36475).
9.4 Implementation level 3
achieving level 3 includes achieving level 2.
In addition, the level 3 standard also includes all kanji and tables specified in the original document and the level 3 standard of the Korean language.
products intended for use in government services and public services must meet the requirements of level 3.

Note: The public administration and utilities sector includes, but is not limited to, the railway transport industry, road transport industry, water transport industry, air transport industry, intermodal transport and transport agency industries, postal industry, financial services industry, insurance industry, real estate industry, management industry, sanitation industry, national institutions, social security industry, etc. (For information on industry classification, see GB4754).

A description of C and C++ compilers is integrated . They all process the input file through one or more of the four steps : preprocessing , compilation ( Hii ) , ( assembly ) MERE ( linking ) .
file extensions indicate the language of the source file, but to the compiler, the extension controls the default settings:
gcc thinks that the preprocessed file (.i) is a c file, and sets up c-style linkage,
g++ considers the preprocessed file (.i) to be a C++ file and sets up C++ style linkage.
The source file header indicates the language type and the subsequent operations:
.c C source program; preprocess, compile, assemble
.C C++ source program; preprocess, compile, assemble
.cc C++ source program; preprocess, compile, link
CXX C++ source program; preprocess, compile, link
.m Objective-C source file; preprocess, compile, link
.i preprocessed c file; compile, assemble
.ii preprocessed c++ file; compile, assemble
.s assembly language source program; assembly
assembly language source program; preprocessing, assembly
.h Preprocessor files; these are usually not seen on the command line, other than as the name of a file passed to the linker (Linker). Typically include:
.0 目標文件 (Object file)
.a archive file
unless the -cec, -s, or -E option is used (or a compile error prevents the whole process), linking is always the last step.

in the link stage , all .e files corresponding to source files , -1 files corresponding to libraries , and unidentified file names ( including specified .o H files and .a libraries ) are passed to the linker options ( OPTIONS ) in the order specified on the command line .
options must be separated by a space : de ' is completely different from `-d -r '.

The following formats are not the default.

except one thing: for C++ programs (not C), the `-traditional` option has an additional effect, allowing assignment to `this`.
He's like the -Ethis-is-variable option.
-traditional-cpp tries to support some aspects of the traditional C preprocessor.
Especially the part about preprocessors, but not the other effects of the `-traditional` option.
-fdollars-in-identifiers allows the use of `$' character in identifiers (only for C++).
You can specify the `-Efno-dollars-in-identifiers' option to make it explicit that `$' is not allowed.
(GNU C++ allows `$' by default on some target systems, but not all.)
-fenum-int-equiv allows implicit conversion from ant type to enumeration type (enumeration) (MEF c++).
Normally, GNU C++ allows conversion from enum to int, but not the other way around.
-fexternal-templates generates smaller code (only in C++) for template declarations (template declarations) by generating a copy of each template function only where they are defined.
To use this option successfully, you must mark all files that use the template with `#pragma implementation` (definition) or `#Pragma interface` (declaration).
At compile time, templates instantiations (template instantiations) are all external types. You must make sure that the instances you need appear in the implementation file.
This can be achieved with typedef, which references each instance that is needed.
Correspondingly, if the compiler is invoked with the option `-fno-extern-templates', all template instances are explicitly set to be inline.
All member functions (except constructors and mnew or delete member operators) are considered virtual in the class in which they are defined.
This does not mean that every call to a member function goes through the internal vtable.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a virtual function can be called directly; in such cases, it is called directly.
-fcond-mismatch allows the types of the second and third parameters of a conditional expression to mismatch.
This expression has a value of void. -fthis-is-variable allows assignment to this (only in C++).
After merging user-defined free storage management into C++, the assignable `this' seems inappropriate.
Therefore, by default, assigning this to itself in the body of a class member function is an invalid operation.
However, to make this operation valid for backward compatibility, you can use the `-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char specifies that char is to be treated as an unsigned type, like unsigned char.
Each machine has its own default char type. It could be unsigned char or signed char.
Ideally , a portable program should use signed char or unsigned char when it depends on the sign of the data .
But many programs are already written using simple chars, and expect that this is a signed number (or unsigned, depending on the target machine the program was written for).
This option and its opposite option make the program work with the corresponding default values.
The type of char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char, even if it is represented exactly the same as one of them.
If no explicit ` signed' or ` unsigned' qualifier is specified, these options define a signed or unsigned bitfield.
By default, bitfields are signed, because they inherit the basic integer type, such as int, which is signed, but if you specify the -traditional option, bitfields are always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in the writable data segment and does not do anything special.
This is for compatibility with some old programs that think it's a bad idea to change string constants `-traditional' option also has the same effect.
executive summary
The impact of COVID-19 on the drug market
its impact could be similar to the 2008 economic crisis
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.
in many countries , the disease has overwhelmed health services , leading to near collapse and governments have imposed restrictions that have caused severe disruption to the global economy .
The impact of the pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be profound.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to make drugs because restrictions on movement also limit access to precursors and basic chemicals.
Traffickers who are unable to travel due to restrictions may have to find new routes and methods.
patterns of drug use and supply may change , and the government's ability to respond may be hampered .
The changes brought by COVID-19 are unprecedented, but there are lessons to be learned from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some addicts started looking for cheaper synthetic substances and switched to injecting drugs.
At the same time, governments have cut funding for drug-related programs.
if governments respond to the current economic downturn in the same way , prevention interventions and treatment services for drug abuse and related risk behaviors may be severely affected .
In addition , the priority given to interdiction and international cooperation may have been reduced , making it easier for traffickers to operate .
Some countries have large amounts of drugs smuggled through commercial flights, and it is expected that these countries will be directly affected by drug trafficking activities.

Couriers carry methamphetamine and other drugs in their carry @-@ on luggage or in their checked bags, sometimes in large quantities . Because almost all countries restrict air travel, the drug trafficking activity that relies on commercial air travel could be completely shut down.
Although the international postal supply chain has been disrupted, the use of the dark web and mail order to ship goods may increase.
In the long term , economic downturns and related measures may disrupt the drug market.

because of the rising unemployment and lack of opportunities , the poor and vulnerable are more likely to use drugs in a harmful way , become addicted , and turn to illegal activities related to drug production or trafficking.
Drug gangs may exploit the situation by providing services to vulnerable people and recruiting new members to swell their ranks.
As government response capabilities have diminished, these changes may take root quickly and become the new reality for many communities.
Expansion and complexity
market growth
population growth explains part of the market expansion
The global drug problem is growing, both in absolute numbers and as a proportion of the world population.

In 2009, an estimated 2.1 billion people, or 4.8% of the global population aged 15–64 years, were estimated to be using drugs, while in 2018, an estimated 269 million people, or 5.3% of the global population aged 15–64 years, were using drugs.
over the past 20 years , the growth of drug abuse in developing countries has far outpaced that of developed countries.

This reflects to some extent the difference in overall population growth, with developed countries at 7% and developing countries at 28%, but also reflects the fact that developing countries have a faster growth rate of young people.
Young people and young adults make up the largest proportion of drug users.
between 2000 and 2018 , the population aged 15 to 64 in developing countries grew by 16 percent , while the population in this age group in developed countries shrank by 10 percent .
1 urbanization is a driver of the current and future drug market
regardless of whether it is a developed country or a developing country, the drug abuse situation in urban areas is more serious than that in rural areas.

One reason for the overall increase in drug use is the massive population shift from rural to urban areas; today, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, compared to 34% in 1960.
urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market , especially in countries with more pronounced urbanization trends .

increases in wealth are associated with more drug use , but the greatest burden of disease is borne by the poorest people worldwide , and drug use is more widespread in developed than in developing countries .
Cocaine and other drugs are more tightly linked to wealthier parts of the world.
Similarly, within countries, the prevalence of drug abuse is higher among the socially affluent.
But the rate of addiction is higher among people with lower socioeconomic status.
data from a few countries suggest that harmful smoking patterns are associated with disease and low income .
these patterns are less common in more affluent strata .
The global economic crisis caused by the COVID @-@ 19 pandemic is likely to exacerbate the risk of drug use among the most vulnerable populations.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment, have been linked to increases in drug use in the past, and the pandemic has already caused millions of people around the world to lose their jobs.

COVID 19 could further expand the drug market COVID 19 's pandemic could lead to more farmers growing or engaging in illicit crops , either because of reduced enforcement capacity of government agencies or because more people are forced to turn to illicit activities in the face of an economic crisis .

Coronavirus-related restrictions have reduced air and road traffic, which may have increased maritime shipments, as the risk of interception is lower and the volume of shipments is higher than air or road smuggling.
There have been recent reports of cocaine shipments being transported by sea from South America to Europe.
complexity amplification
the emergence of new, potentially dangerous synthetic opioids has increased the complexity of the drug market , and the situation remains stable for non @-@ controlled substances .

in addition to plant @-@ based drugs such as cannabis , cocaine , and heroin , hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added , many of which are not internationally controlled . Nonmedical use of prescription drugs is also increasing .
Member States have an average of 500 new psychoactive substances entering their national markets each year.
most of these are stimulants , followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a few synthetic opioids .
although the overall number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized , the proportions have changed .
In the total number of new psychoactive substances confirmed in 2014, the proportion of new synthetic opioids was only 2%, but by 2018, this number had risen to 9%.

many of the new synthetic opioid psychoactive substances are fentanyl analogues , with proven pharmacological and toxic effects that have led to overdose deaths in North America , with lesser degrees of impact in other regions .
in North America , fentanyl is used as an adulterant for heroin and other drugs ( including cocaine and methamphetamine ) , and also as a precursor to counterfeit fentanyl analogues .

Some evidence suggests that the injection of new psychoactive stimulants is also taking place in Europe: a study of residues left on discarded syringes in six European cities found that many of the syringes were contaminated with substances that produce stimulant effects
2 New psychoactive substances use may become increasingly entrenched in disadvantaged groups
single types of new psychoactive substances have rarely formed large markets .
But evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among homeless people and prisoners - marginalised groups.
Twenty-two countries reported on the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with most countries identifying synthetic cannabinoids as the main challenge .
The international control of many precursor chemicals used in the illicit manufacture of methamphetamine, amphetamine and "ecstasy" has forced drug traffickers to be innovative.
traffickers and manufacturers have long sought out alternatives to controlled substances, including "designer precursors" that are specifically designed to evade controls.
Restrictive measures aimed at stopping the spread of COVID-19 may further squeeze drug traffickers who rely on precursors.

Evidence from Mexico suggests that this is already the case: a report from March 2020 indicates that a shortage of methamphetamine precursors imported from East Asia drove up the price of methamphetamine in Mexico and the United States.
in a fast-moving market.
Synthetic Opioids Replace Heroin in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
the heroin market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have changed between 2008 and 2018 .
The amount of heroin seized by federal authorities in Russia has dropped by about 80 percent, and the number of people receiving treatment for opioid use has plummeted.
But the stimulant market seems to be booming.
there is evidence that methamphetamine and various cathinones , including mephedrone and a - pyrrolidinophenone , are now widely available on the Russian drug market .
Russian authorities have reported a sharp increase in the number of secret laboratories producing illegal drugs, with 152 such facilities discovered in 2018, up from 70 in 2016.
Methamphetamine Markets in Afghanistan and Iraq
investigations of hospital , prison , and other personnel in Iraq had already revealed the importance of methamphetamine in 2012 .
Crystal methamphetamine has become another major drug of concern , along with fentanyl and tramadol.
A 2015 study further confirmed these findings, with users saying that marijuana was harder to get than "Captagon" or methamphetamine.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine processing labs, and the DEA has expressed concern about the large quantities of pseudoephedrine-based products being imported, which are used as precursors in methamphetamine labs.
methamphetamine production appears to have started in Afghanistan in 2014 .
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have been steadily increasing.
However, the seizures in the first half of 2019 amounted to 657 kg - a sharp increase compared to the previous year.
Large quantities of methamphetamine, believed to be of Afghan origin, have been seized in other countries, which also indicates that production is on the rise.
policy changes and trends
legalization of marijuana for nonmedical use has been associated with increased marijuana use.
Canada, Uruguay and 11 U.S. states allow the production of marijuana products for non-medical use.

In most jurisdictions where cannabis has been legalized, use has increased since legalization, although similar trends have been observed in jurisdictions where cannabis for nonmedical purposes remains illegal.

In the two states where marijuana was first legalized for recreational use, Colorado and Washington, the number of adults using marijuana has increased, especially among those who use it daily or almost daily, which has been above the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that marijuana use has increased in Uruguay since 2011, and nearly doubled last month.
This suggests that the increase is primarily due to more frequent and frequent use of marijuana.
Canada's short-term data also show that as the legal market expanded from 2018 to 2019, consumption increased.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products from the illicit market.
Is the global drop in cannabis herb seizures due to legalization?
In 2018, global cannabis herb seizures fell to their lowest levels in two decades, due to a 84% drop in North America over the past decade.
In contrast, seizures in the rest of the world nearly doubled. The seizure pattern suggests that policies aimed at liberalizing the cannabis market have played a key role in the decline.
the control of new psychoactive substances seems to have a restraining effect on the country, but the effect of the control of new psychoactive substances is still difficult to evaluate.
countries with different regulatory regimes for NPS have shown different patterns of NPS use .
in other countries , the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after national legislation .

vulnerable populations are disproportionately affected by the harms of both legal and illicit drug markets for pain management and palliative care with opioid analgesics being unequally distributed across regions in high @-@ income countries .
in 2018 , more than 90 % of all opioids available for medical consumption were in high @-@ income countries .
About 50% are in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
These countries account for about 12 percent of the world's population.
an estimated 88 % of the global population resides in low @-@ and middle @-@ income countries , but less than 10 % of opioid consumption occurs in these countries.
obtaining opioids for nonmedical use is influenced by many factors , including legislation , culture , health care systems , and prescribing practices .
People in poorer areas are more likely to have a drug problem, with around 3.56 million people estimated to have a drug problem in 2018.

poverty , limited education , and social marginalization may increase the risk of addiction and exacerbate its consequences . Research in high @-@ income countries has shown that individual disadvantages in the social @-@ economic sphere are not only associated with a person's status at a given point in time but also with the risk of addiction .

addiction exacerbates social and economic disadvantage , further increasing the risks of unemployment , poverty , and homelessness , and thus perpetuating disadvantage in a vicious cycle . These outcomes may also be related to the demeaning attitudes and consequences of the criminal justice system .

women , ethnic minorities , migrants , diverse sexual orientation groups , and people displaced by conflict or disaster , as well as those in rural settings , may be disproportionately affected by substance use disorders or may have difficulty accessing treatment services .

harmful smoking has had a greater impact on society over the past decade, according to the disability @-@ adjusted life @-@ year ( DALY ) indicator , which estimates the number of healthy years of life lost to disability and premature death .
between 2007 and 2018 , the global burden of disability attributable to drug use increased by 17 % .
the increase in life expectancy among untreated hepatitis C related sequelae of injection drug users was particularly high , at 40 % .
the relationship between drugs and violence is complex and difficult to determine all the causal relationships between drug use and violence.
limited global data suggest that intoxication may be an important factor in homicide .
But in violent incidents, alcohol seems to have a bigger effect than drugs.

although drug use may be associated with crime , in some cases , this association can be partially attributed to a variety of intervening factors , including social and economic disadvantage and other types of adversity that are influenced by individual risk factors , family environment , and peer influences .
The link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted.
If there are stable criminal structures, including large-scale organized criminal activities such as international drug trafficking, they can be carried out without violence.

in the short term , the presence and intensity of violence are more likely to be determined by changes in the balance of power among organized criminal groups - for example , changes in the size of the illicit market , the death or incarceration of prominent criminals , and law enforcement actions that make one group vulnerable to another .
latest trends
Cannabis is the most commonly used substance , followed by opioids , which cause the most harm.
An estimated 192 million people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug globally.
In comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
But the dangers of opioids have been largely ignored because users are so few.

in 2017 , an estimated 167,000 deaths related to drug use disorders , 66 % of which were attributable to these substances , occurred , as did 50 % of the 21 million years of potential life lost to disabilities or premature death attributed to drug use disorders .
Synthetic Opioid Use Outside of Medical Care Intensifies Public Health Crisis

in West Africa , Central Africa , and North Africa , the opioid crisis is fueled by tramadol ; in North America , it is fueled by fentanyl . These two regions have little in common economically , demographically , or in terms of general patterns of drug use , but both are struggling to combat crises fueled by easily accessible , low @-@ cost substances .
in North America , synthetic opioids such as fentanyl have driven a 20 @-@ year increase in opioid overdose deaths.
In 2018, fentanyl was involved in two thirds of the 67,367 registered overdose deaths in the United States.
Canada also reported similar results, but with lower numbers.
Fentanyl overdose deaths are in part due to unpredictable drug effects in the illicit drug market .
the nonmedical use of tramadol has grown markedly in West Africa , Central Africa , and North Africa .
in this region , the use of tramadol for the treatment of pain is becoming more common.
in 2017 , global seizures of tramadol increased significantly , reaching a peak of more than 125 tons .
But in 2018, global seizures fell to 32 tons after India passed a new law to regulate tramadol.
The crises were fueled by the ease of manufacture and low cost of production, as well as the lack of international oversight of tramadol and many fentanyl analogues or precursors.
What makes these crises worse is that these substances are available on both the legal and illegal markets, making them harder to detect and prevent.
the use of stimulants is increasing
the stimulant market is dominated by cocaine and methamphetamine , both of which are increasing in use in their primary markets .
There are about 19 million people who use cocaine in 2018, because cocaine is quite popular in North America and Western Europe.
an estimated 27 million people used methamphetamine , with methamphetamine being the most commonly used amphetamine type stimulant in Southeast Asia and North America.
according to most indicators , methamphetamine use has been increasing in both regions over the past 20 years .

in some markets , cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist , sometimes substituting for one another , so that when use of one drug goes up , use of the other goes down , and sometimes both go up and down simultaneously to meet market demand .
COVID-19 raises risks for injection drug users
An estimated 11.3 million people injected drugs in 2018, and approximately 10% of the global HIV infections were due to injecting drug use.
More than 100,000 people who inject drugs are infected with HIV, and 550,000 have hepatitis C.
In 2017, an estimated 585,000 people died from drug overdoses, half of whom died from liver disease caused by hepatitis C, while many injection drug users with hepatitis C remain untreated.

EU Summit Debates Refugee Policy, EU Official: Reception Process Bottlenecks - Eastday (eastday.com)
EU summit dominated by refugee policy disputes, EU official: bottlenecks exist in every step of the reception process

(Global Times Brussels Special Correspondent Ni Ruifei) According to Agence France-Presse on February 10, at the latest EU summit, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said that EU leaders agreed to adopt more stringent policies on illegal immigration to make it easier to expel illegal immigrants.
The move is reportedly a response to the growing problem of illegal immigration in Europe. The problem is that the number of illegal immigrants who can be deported is very small.
According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the committee to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" to strengthen external borders with infrastructure and monitoring.
However, the EU and its member states continue to argue over the payment of border costs.
Von der Leyen has repeatedly said that EU funds will not pay for the costs.

But some member states' diplomats say that if the EU can shoulder part of the cost of installing cameras, lighthouses and other infrastructure along the external borders, this would help speed up the construction process and ease the burden on national budgets.

Euractiv.eu, a European website, said that EU officials admitted that there are bottlenecks in every step of the refugee reception process, limited reception capacity, and an immigration system that cannot bear the burden of the member states, which cannot prevent refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in various EU countries. The EU refugee reception system is in a "near permanent crisis".
According to the European Union Committee, EU countries received more than 92,000 asylum applications last year, an increase of nearly half compared to the previous year.
At the same time, the EU recorded more than 33,000 illegal entries last year.
Against this backdrop, the summit also agreed on a "principle" agreement, which allows EU countries to deport illegal immigrants to another member state based on a court ruling.
In addition, the EU leaders agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries", which would pave the way for the EU to draw up a common list.
(Source: Global Times, author: Ni Ruifei)

In the

In recent years, the United States has never stopped attacking the development of China's "core" and has been precise in suppressing the supply chain of the semiconductor industry in China while constructing a "de-Sinicization" semiconductor industry chain alliance to completely "discard" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is to establish a "technological alliance" with South Korea, or to establish a "chip four-party alliance" with South Korea, Japan, and Taiwan, or to establish a "small circle" of the semiconductor industry chain through mechanisms such as the "Four-Party Mechanism" and the "Indo-Pacific Economic Framework", the United States has introduced political, factional, and weaponized means into the semiconductor
However, the US’s high-profile “chip war” against China is also a “thousand injured, eight hundred self-damaged”.

Recently, the well-known American chip manufacturing equipment supplier, Sanmina-SCI Group, announced that it would lay off 1,300 full-time employees due to the impact of the latest round of export restrictions on Chinese chip manufacturing equipment, and it would lay off 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters.

The global leader in lithography, ASML Holding NV of the Netherlands, recently warned that a ban on exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China could lead to a rise in semiconductor prices.

According to the US media analysis, many US companies have been severely affected after the US government has imposed a heavy blow on the Chinese semiconductor and semiconductor industries. This includes the developers of electronic design automation tools, chip designers, manufacturers of wafer fabrication equipment, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The United States' so-called suppression of China's advanced semiconductor industry has dragged down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry, and has formed a closely connected global semiconductor industry chain.

According to professional estimates, due to the specialization of labor, the entire production process of semiconductor products requires more than 70 cross-border crossings, and the entire process takes 100 days.

Although the US semiconductor industry has a strong foundation, it is weak in manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced process technology and craftsmanship, and is heavily dependent on the Asia-Pacific region.

Even if the United States is trying to lead the advanced chip production and supply chain to turn to the "small circle" area, it is difficult to change the global regional distribution and interdependence of the semiconductor industry.
The United States is strongly "restructuring" and "de-Sinicization" of the semiconductor industry chain, and re-creating the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of the global future industry, and the development of the chip industry cannot be separated from the participation of all countries in the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, such as the Innovation and Competition Act of 2021, the 2022 Competition Act, and the Chips and Science Act, to use technological hegemony to consolidate its technological leadership advantage; and to "favor friends and frighten enemies", it has coerced chip manufacturers such as Intel, TSMC, and Samsung to set up factories in
In the short term, the United States has indeed caused trouble for China's chip industry and related industries, and reaped real benefits.

However, in the long run, the US crackdown on China's semiconductor industry will force China's semiconductor industry to break through, and ultimately lead to the loss of a huge Chinese market, which will greatly weaken the innovative willingness and innovative ability of US technology companies, and harm the development of the global semiconductor industry.

First batch of individual pension financial products go on sale, minimum holding period is 360 days - Chinanews.com
The first batch of individual pension financial products goes on sale
7 products are available for the home appliance category, with the minimum holding period of 360 days.
Personal pension financial products finally go online.

On February 10, China Finance Network released the first batch of personal pension financial products, and seven personal pension financial products of Guobao Finance, Nongde Finance, and Zhongyou Finance were officially launched.

At this point, the "shelf" of personal pension accounts has finally gathered four types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension financial planning, personal pension insurance, and personal pension public fund products.

According to the introduction, the first batch of individual pension financial products are all public offerings of net asset value open-ended products, of which 5 new issues and 2 continuation issues are issued, and except for 1 mixed type product, the remaining 6 products are fixed income type products.

According to a reporter from Beijing Youth Daily, among the five new products, four are from Guotai Junan Securities, all of which are fixed-income products, with the shortest holding period of 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) are 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.1

The remaining new issue product is "Bank of Communications Wealth Addition Heng Jin Shortest Holding 1095 Days No. 1", which is also a fixed-income product, and will start collecting on February 10th and end on February 19th, with a risk level of II.

Among the two continuous products, one is the Agricultural Bank of China's "Agricultural Bank of China Same Heart · Spirit Dynamic" 360-day technology innovation RMB financial product, which has an investment nature of mixed type and a risk level of three levels.

Another continuing product is "Postal Savings Bank Wealth Management Hengjin Shortest Holding 1 No.," a fixed-income type, which started collecting funds on December 30 last year and officially started operation on January 4 this year, with a cumulative net value of 1.0011 on February 8.

According to the Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension Insurance, the financial products that can be invested in the account of the pension fund include bank trust, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, public fund investment, etc.
The first batch of personal pension financial products was sold, marking that personal pension investors can officially purchase financial products through personal pension fund accounts.
In November last year, the CBIRC issued the Temporary Measures for the Administration of Individual Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Asset Management Companies.

The Regulations stipulate that the participants can purchase personal pension savings, personal pension financial products, personal pension insurance products, personal pension public fund products and other personal pension products through the personal pension fund account.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxation issued a notice, clarifying that the pension system for individuals was launched in 36 pioneering cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, Shijiazhuang and Xiong'an New Area in Hebei Province, and Jincheng City in Shanxi Province.

By the end of 2022, the number of people participating in individual pension insurance will be 19.54 million, the number of people paying will be 6.13 million, and the total amount of contributions will be 14.2 billion yuan.
Previously, the participating banks only launched three types of products, namely personal pension savings, personal pension insurance and personal pension public fund.
Now that individual pension financial products have gathered, how should investors choose?

An expert from the research and development department of Taishin Financial Products said that compared with other individual pension products, the trial-stage pension financial products and individual pension financial products both have three characteristics.
The first is stability, with more complete risk management mechanisms, more stable investment strategies and ideas, and implementation of third-party independent custody by non-parent banks.

The second is long-term. The term of the pilot retirement financial products is more than 5 years, and the next individual retirement financial products to be issued will have the shortest holding term of 1 year, and it is encouraged to hold for more than 3 years.

The third is inclusiveness. The purchase threshold of the product is low, and the starting point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan. The fees for storage, management, etc. of the product are more preferential.
Experts say that investors should choose products based on the product features and their risk tolerance.

Individual pension savings have the characteristics of long term, high interest rate and high security, which are suitable for people with weak risk tolerance; individual pension insurance products focus on guarantee, which are more suitable for people who cannot bear investment risk and can accept stable income; while individual pension financial products and public fund products do not guarantee principal and interest, have certain investment risk, but the expected return is higher, which are suitable for people who have certain financial knowledge and risk tolerance.
Article/Reporter: Cheng Pei, Coordinator: Chi Hai-bo
Fitness Industry Should Avoid Trust Crisis - Eastday
Another big gym "bust"?
Recently, the issue of the Zhongjian Fitness Club member rights protection has attracted public attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that the stores they were in were not operating normally. Subsequently, rumors about the collapse of the institution caused members to panic, leading to the intervention of the public security and human resources departments.
Finally, the responsible person of the institution came forward to respond and promised to make efforts to protect the legal rights of employees and members, which helped to calm the storm.

Some individual fitness centers have encountered operational problems, causing some of their stores to temporarily close. Consumers can be patient and wait for the problem to be resolved. Why do some members' first reaction be "something is wrong"?
Behind the member rights protection storm of the fitness club, there is a deep-seated problem of trust crisis in the industry.
Traditional gyms in China usually adopt the prepaid model, and "earning money from users who do not come" is the bottom logic of their development.
By obtaining cash flow through pre-sale of membership cards and opening new stores, it seems that it can be circulated, but in fact, it is eating bitterness and cannot form a stable profit model.
Negative information about the fitness industry and running industry is frequently released, which has a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the perspective of market prospects, fitness clubs are indeed a good business with "money-making potential".
The fitness industry may be up and down, but it always attracts capital attention.
Multiple data show that the consumption of cultural and creative products is heating up, and the market is continuously warming up.

Specifically, in the fitness market, with the steady improvement of residents' living standards and the deepening of the concept of healthy living, the fitness industry has great potential for development.
The better the situation, the more the industry needs to focus on quality development.

However, individual institutions were overly optimistic about the fitness market, which was recovering from consumption, and sounded the horn of expansion and opening of new stores, pouring investment funds into new store construction.

It cannot be denied that, influenced by the epidemic in recent years, many institutions have withdrawn, the industry has reshuffled, and the enterprises with strength have selectively increased their acquisition intensity and restructured, which has brought new opportunities.
However, to enter the virtuous circle of the fitness market development, the industry must change the traditional mode and change the operating strategy.
Only by firmly establishing consumer trust and security can we truly win the market and the future.
Compared with the new store opening, the fitness industry currently needs to focus on optimizing services and developing high-quality services to stabilize users.
First, you have to keep your customers by providing good service.
Gyms belong to the service industry, and their essence is to adhere to "customer orientation". They should focus on user needs and put the focus of their operation on service quality upgrades.
Second, digital transformation should improve user experience.
For example, the current popular Internet fitness model realizes that users pay by the time and choose the venue.
At the same time, body data and sports data can be effectively used to meet social needs and achieve a complete closed loop of services from online to offline.
Without private tutoring promotion, without large annual card, users' concerns about "running away" from fitness institutions have been reduced, and trust has been improved.
In addition, we should actively explore multi-industry development.

Now, sports consumption has evolved from single service to scene consumption, and fitness clubs have the potential to become a new entry point for consumption, and around the sports supplements and fitness equipment needed for fitness, or will become a new profit point, providing consumers with more choices.

Multiple data show decline, Taiwan economy starts the year poorly - Chinanews.com

Xinhua News Agency, Taipei, February 11 (Reporters: Zhao Bo, Huang Yang) Export trade volume "continues to fall", the purchasing managers' index (PMI) for the manufacturing industry has been contracting for seven consecutive months, and the consumer price index (CPI) has seen a "three-digit increase"... Recently, Taiwan's authorities have been releasing economic data for January 2023.
Economists say that Taiwan's economy has started the year poorly, and growth pressure is not small.

According to the financial affairs management department of the Taiwan authorities, Taiwan's exports in January this year were US$31.51 billion, down 21.2% year-on-year, and negative growth for the fifth consecutive month.
11 major export commodities saw their export value decline compared with the same period last year.
The decline of plastic rubber and its products, and optical instruments was the most severe, with a year-on-year decrease of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
Exports of electronic components fell 20.1% year-on-year, the biggest drop in 11 years.
Among them, the annual decline of integrated circuits was 18.3%, the largest decline in 14 years.

Cai Mina, the head of the department's statistics department, said that this shows that the demand for consumer electronics is weakening, and that the electronics industry is entering a period of adjustment.
According to statistics, in January, Taiwan's imports and exports both fell, and the export amount was only US$2.34 billion, the lowest level in the past three years.

Taiwan’s government financial affairs management department believes that the global terminal demand is reduced, the industry adjusts the inventory to suppress the merchant’s purchasing intention, the export is in a weak position and it is difficult to see an improvement in the short term, and Taiwan’s export decline in the first quarter of this year may be higher than expected.

According to the Chung-Hua Institution for Economic Research in Taiwan, the Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) in Taiwan in January 2021 was 40.4% after seasonal adjustment, which was 3.3 percentage points lower than the previous year’s December, and 7 consecutive months of contraction.
In the economic monitoring index system, PMI is 50% as the line of death, and the index greater than 50% represents the expansion of the situation, otherwise it is shrinking.
In January, the five components of the Taiwan PMI were tightened, with new orders, production, and labor employment tightened, supplier delivery time shortened, and inventory tightened.

All six industries reported a contraction in the PMI, with the ranking of the contraction speed as follows: electrical machinery and equipment industry (35.1%), electronic and optical industry (35.2%), chemical and pharmaceutical industry (39.2%), basic raw materials industry (42.4%), transportation equipment industry (42.6%), and food and textile industry (45.7%).

On the price side, the "Directorate General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics" of the Taiwan government announced that the annual increase of CPI in Taiwan in January 2018 was 3.04%, which exceeded 3% again since July last year.
Among them, vegetable prices rose 28.25%, setting a new high in 17 months.

Cao Zhihong, a special commissioner of the Taiwan "Bureau of Statistics", admitted that the increase in food prices was indeed greater than expected. Excluding the influence of the Chinese New Year, the average CPI in January and February this year should be close to 2.71% in December last year, and the inflationary pressure still exists and is still high.
Looking forward to Taiwan's economy this year, according to the reports of the United Daily News and "Yahoo Finance" and other domestic media, experts are pessimistic.

Professor Wu Da Ren of the Economics Department of Central University in Taiwan analyzed that the export downturn may cause cash flow problems for exporters in the manufacturing industry, and the risk of default on debt will increase.
At the same time, the reduction in orders leads to the reduction of labor costs for enterprises, which affects the labor market and family economy, and then affects the consumption ability.

Qu Dashan, a researcher at the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, believes that the Eurozone and the United States have not yet resolved their inflation situation, and that demand will continue to shrink. Therefore, it is estimated that Taiwan's export decline will continue into the first half of the year.
Taiwan's economy is export-oriented, so it will be affected by the decline in exports, and the annual economic growth will not be as good as last year.

China News Service Financial Reporter Xia Bin
"We were late to the e-commerce game, but we knew from the start that to stand out from the millions of stores out there, content is key.
"Flower" is a 90s girl from Guangdong, who now operates a supplementary food store on Douyin, helping a 30-year-old offline store to "bloom" online.
The video, which imitates the style of old Hong Kong movies and is set to classic Cantonese songs, is a delightful surprise when you open @芳芳一人食抖音賬號.

At the recent TikTok e-commerce "Find Your Peers · Quality Content Sharing Area", Fangfang, as a representative of quality creators, spoke on stage and introduced her daily creation experience and feelings.

Fang Fang's live broadcasts of making herbal soups have made more people fall in love with the taste of "Old Guangzhou", and one live broadcast sold up to 300,000 supplementary food ingredients, saving a family business from the brink of closure.
"No content, no e-commerce", with the continuous development of short videos and live e-commerce, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early stage of live e-commerce, live rooms often use low prices and discounts to attract users, and price advantage seems to be the only selling point at that time.

In recent years, there are not only phenomenon-level big Vs such as Liu Xiang Mao and Dongfang Zhenxuan, but also many unknown experts and merchants who have emerged in vertical niches. They have continuously created high-quality content that is in line with their brand image, thus improving their long-term operating efficiency.

High Ashen, the operator and responsible person of the star author of Douyin e-commerce, introduced that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have transformed their content through Douyin e-commerce, and the growth of their content creation has increased by 252%, and the total transaction amount has doubled.
"Behind these numbers, we can feel a vibrant, vital author ecosystem.
"said hoyaekon.

Beijing Normal University’s Communication Innovation and Future Media Experiment Platform previously published the “E-commerce Industry Content Ecosystem Health Index (ECHI) Report”, which analyzed the importance of “new variables” in the current e-commerce industry, namely high-quality content, from a data perspective, and used the index to evaluate the ecosystem of content on 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the health index of the e-commerce industry content ecology in the above report, Douyin e-commerce, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com ranked first to fifth.

The report believes that the e-commerce content ecosystem is a comprehensive concept, which is to integrate e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. Good PGC (professional production content) and UGC (user-generated content) are the quality carriers for integration with e-commerce. The higher the value of the content platform, the richer the consumption and promotion scenarios, the higher the possibility of e-commerce implantation, the

On the scene, Professor Yu Guoming, Dean of the School of Journalism and Communication of Beijing Normal University and Chairman of the Council of the China Media Economy and Management Special Committee, made an analysis and interpretation of the report.

He said that in terms of content value, the current e-commerce industry has transitioned from the “accessibility of consumption” to the “quality of consumption” stage, and high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the “hard currency” of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the root and handle of the new stage of e-commerce development, and PGC content such as paid knowledge, professional knowledge, KOL (key opinion leader) has begun to become standard in e-commerce live broadcasting.
Looking forward to the future development of the e-commerce industry, Yin Guoming made two suggestions.
一是从内容结构提升的角度出发,推动电商内容生态健康度和质量整体提升,打造正向内容创作和管理标准,实现电商行业内容生态健康系数与动态均衡。
Another is to look at the external ecology, to achieve the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value of cooperation and co-creation with the external environment.

“In the future, the e-commerce industry will need more data and support from artificial intelligence to make predictions about stability of future development; in addition, it will provide more regulated and healthy growth space for merchants, realize the value of collaboration between enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry, and create a healthy content ecosystem.

(Deutsche Welle Chinese) The Biden administration will blacklist six Chinese entities on Friday (February 10) for suspected involvement in the spy balloon program.

The US Department of Commerce said that these five Chinese companies and one research institute have helped the Chinese military modernize, especially in the aerospace field, including airships and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist have a hard time getting U.S. technology exports.

The list is known as the "entity list," and companies on it are barred from buying U.S. technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they obtain a special export license from the Commerce Department.

The companies listed in the blacklist are: Beijing South River Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd., the 48th Research Institute of China Electronics Technology Group Corporation, Dongguan Lingshan Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd., Tianmen Aerospace Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xingshan Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Tianmen Aerospace Technology Group Co., Ltd.
Before that, the White House had considered broader measures to "expose and counter" what it said were larger-scale surveillance operations by China to threaten U.S. national security.
The balloon incident has further strained the US-China relationship, and US Secretary of State Blinken has canceled his visit to China.

On February 4, the United States shot down a balloon, and the Chinese government made a serious protest to the US embassy in China, criticizing the United States for seriously violating and damaging the efforts and progress of both sides to maintain stable Sino-US relations.

Based on existing evidence of the wreckage and information from the Chinese military's procurement platform, the U.S. government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon "has a direct relationship with the Chinese military" and is an approved supplier by the Chinese military.

On Friday, Foreign Ministry spokesperson Mao Ning said at a press conference that China has repeatedly explained the situation and clarified its position regarding the incident of a Chinese drone mistakenly entering US airspace due to unavoidable circumstances.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the resolution of the US Congress was purely political manipulation and hype.
China is strongly dissatisfied and firmly opposed to this.

"Today's action demonstrates that we are taking steps to identify and stop China's use of these balloons, which violate U.S. and dozens of other countries' airspace," said Matthew Axelrod, assistant secretary for export enforcement at the Commerce Department.
Reuters reported that an employee of Guangzhou Tianhe Xingsheng Aviation Technology Co., Ltd. said he did not know about the sanctions and declined to comment further.
The Chinese Embassy in the United States has not yet commented on this information.

Rescuers first pulled the mother and daughter from the rubble, then found the father, but he insisted on rescuing his son and another daughter first.
When they were all rescued, the crowd cheered.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were rescued in poor weather conditions with freezing temperatures.
"What day is it today?
"This is the boy who was trapped under the rubble for 129 hours asking the rescue workers to save him after he was brought back to the surface.
A man from Kahramanmaras holds his cat that was just rescued
Successful rescue cases have given a glimmer of hope to the search and rescue work that was already in despair, but at the same time, the number of people in distress is also increasing.
According to the official statistics, the earthquake on Monday has caused more than 20,000 deaths in Turkey, and the death toll in neighboring Syria is estimated to be more than 3,500.
Although experts say people can survive for more than a week after being trapped in rubble, the hope of finding more survivors is fading.
Rescue workers are still using thermal imaging cameras to search for signs of life under the rubble.
Meanwhile, the focus of the rescue operation is shifting to help those who are most in need.
UN official: 'Century-defining' disaster in Haiti

Martin Griffiths, the UN's Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Coordinator, said at a press conference in Turkey that the earthquake was "the worst disaster in the region in a century."
He also praised Turkey's "unusual" response to the disaster.
He told Reuters he hoped aid could be delivered to government and opposition-controlled areas in Syria, but said the situation was "not clear."
The United Nations has pledged an additional $25 million in aid to the Syrian people affected by the earthquake.
Earlier this week, the United Nations announced a $25 million allocation for Turkey and Syria for the relief effort.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Chile Earthquake (1960)
At 3:11 p.m. local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever observed was recorded in Valdivia, Chile, with a magnitude of 9.5.
In just 10 minutes, Valdivia destroys an entire city.
The earthquake triggered a massive tsunami that hit the Chilean coast, causing waves up to 25 meters high.
Tsunami waves hit faraway Japan and the Philippines.
The death toll and monetary losses arising from this widespread disaster are not certain.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
The Great Alaska Earthquake of 1964
March 27, 1964, was a Friday, and it was Good Friday.
On this day, the largest earthquake in the history of North America occurred in Alaska, USA, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake was still the third largest earthquake in the world's history.
When the earthquake hit, a fault line between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate broke near College Fjord, close to Prince William Sound.
The earthquake lasted for three to five minutes in most areas.
The sea floor displacement triggered a tsunami with a height of 67 meters.
Schools and many businesses were closed because it was a holiday.
The earthquake ultimately killed 139 people.
Nine people died directly from the earthquake, while 130 others died from the tsunami triggered by the earthquake.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Tangshan Earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two earthquakes of magnitude 7 or above occurred in Tangshan City and Pingnan County, Hebei Province, China, within 16 hours.
The epicenter is 23 kilometers deep.
Tangshan City, the whole city's traffic, communication, water supply, and power supply were cut off, and it was flattened in an instant.
The capital Beijing, 140 kilometers away, also felt strong tremors.
According to official statistics, the earthquake caused 242,769 deaths and 164,851 serious injuries in all the disaster-stricken areas, including Beijing and Tianjin.
The Tangshan earthquake is the second deadliest earthquake in China with records, only second to the Jiajing earthquake in 1556.
But some foreign scientists estimate that the earthquake may have killed at least 650,000 people.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Indian Ocean earthquake (2004)
On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred 160 km west of the coast of Aceh Province, Sumatra, Indonesia, with a depth of 30 km and a moment magnitude of 9.1 to 9.3.
The earthquake triggered a tsunami with waves as high as 15 to 30 feet.
A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected, with the worst-hit areas including Aceh province in Indonesia, Phuket tourist zone in Thailand, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu in India.

The disaster struck during the peak holiday season, when the area was packed with tourists and locals, causing many holidaymakers enjoying the beach and locals working by the sea to be swept away by the tsunami, making the quake one of the deadliest in recent years.
It is estimated that at least 300,000 people were killed or went missing.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Sichuan earthquake (2008)
On May 12, 2008, a major earthquake occurred in Wenchuan, Sichuan Province, China.

According to the data from the China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave magnitude of the earthquake reached 8.2, and the moment magnitude reached 8.3, and the area affected by the earthquake exceeded 100,000 square kilometers.

Up to September 25, 2008, the earthquake caused 69,227 deaths, 17,923 missing, 3,746,430 injured people, 19.93 million people lost their homes, and the total population affected by the earthquake was 46.26 million.
It was the most destructive earthquake in the history of the People's Republic of China, and also the most severe casualty after the Tangshan earthquake.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 of each year would be designated as Disaster Prevention and Mitigation Day, and that efforts would be made to strengthen public education and attention to disaster prevention and mitigation.
Afterwards, many Chinese governments and primary and middle schools hold earthquake drills on this day every year.
Primary and middle schools also began to pay attention to popularizing "earthquake prevention and mitigation" education.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, a 7.0-magnitude earthquake occurred in the sea of the Caribbean islands and the countries of Haiti.
The epicenter of the earthquake was located 25 kilometers southwest of Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti, and the depth of the earthquake was about 13 kilometers.
The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies estimated that as many as 3 million people had been affected by the quake.
The Haitian government has confirmed more than 20,000 deaths.
In some areas of Haiti, up to 90% of homes were destroyed.
Despite massive international aid and support, this population-exploded, corrupt, impoverished country has never recovered from the disaster.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
The Great East Japan Earthquake (2011)
On March 11, 2011, a magnitude 9.0 megathrust earthquake occurred off the coast of northeastern Japan.

The earthquake occurred in the Pacific Ocean east of Sendai, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, and the depth of the earthquake focus was measured at 24 kilometers, which triggered a massive tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 meters.
This earthquake was the first earthquake of magnitude 9 or greater ever recorded in Japan.
Approximately 22,000 people died in the disaster, and approximately 40,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant was affected by earthquake and tsunami, causing a leakage accident.
The accident was classified as the most serious level 7 on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
the Fukushima accident resulted in the detection of trace amounts of radioactive materials worldwide , including iodine @-@ 131 and caesium @-@ 137 ( with a half @-@ life of 30 years ) .
A large amount of radioactive isotopes was released into the Pacific Ocean.
According to the United Nations statistics, at least 870,000 people need food in the disaster areas of Pakistan and India.
In Syria alone, more than 5.3 million people have lost their homes to earthquakes.
The World Food Programme (WFP) has appealed for $77 million to provide food for people displaced by the earthquake in Turkey and Syria.
The temperature in the disaster area has dropped to below zero, and many victims have no place to stay.
The Turkish government has distributed large quantities of hot meals, tents and blankets, but the aid is still not reaching many of the people in desperate need.
In Syria, where a 12-year-long civil war has already made life unbearable for many, the earthquake has added to their misery.
In the four days since the earthquake, the World Food Programme has provided food assistance to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for the treatment of external injuries and emergency surgery.

Fraud warning:
1. Pay more attention to network security information, and improve personal awareness of prevention;
2. Do not log in to unknown websites and register personal and credit card information on the website to prevent theft;
3. Beware of fake websites and fishing websites, and always check whether the website address is completely consistent with the official website;
4. Install antivirus software on your mobile device, computer, or other devices and keep it updated;

Google AI chatbot "gives wrong answers" parent company stock evaporates billions of dollars
(Compiled on November 11)

Google's new AI chatbot Bard has had a rocky start, "answering questions incorrectly" in a promotional video, causing the share price of Google's parent company Alphabet to plunge 8.9% on Tuesday, falling below $100 for the first time, and wiping $110 billion (about RMB 4765 billion) off its market value, closing at $94.57 on Friday.
Market worried that Alphabet is not as good as its competitor Microsoft.

According to Reuters, Google released an advertisement for AI chatbot Bard earlier than expected on social media, in which someone asked Bard: "What new discoveries can I tell my 9-year-old about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST)?
"Bard mentions in his answer that this telescope was the first to photograph an extrasolar planet.
However, according to NASA data, the first photo of an extrasolar planet was taken by the "Extremely Large Telescope" of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters also reported the news under the title of "Alphabet stock plummeted after Bard's wrong answer".

On the other hand, Google said that Bard's response "highlights the importance of the rigorous testing process," and will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's response "meets high standards for quality, safety, and truth."
Singapore's tourism industry recovers strongly, with inbound tourists increasing 19 times compared to 2021

(Summary of 11th day) The Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that it expects the number of international visitors to Singapore in 2023 to be between 12 million and 14 million, which will bring in about S$1.8 billion to S$2.1 billion in tourism revenue; the number of visitors and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID-19 pandemic
The Singapore tourism market is gradually restarting and recovering in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) show that the number of inbound tourists in 2022 increased by 19 times compared to 2021's 33.06 million, reaching 63 million, exceeding the STB's previous forecast of 40-60 million, and the number of tourists has recovered to 33% of the pre-pandemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore's tourism revenue was 89.6 billion yuan, and it is expected that the tourism revenue for the whole year of 2022 will reach 138-143 billion yuan, which is 6-7 times that of 2021 (18.9 billion yuan), and has recovered to about 50%-52% of the level before
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced that it would allocate nearly 500 million yuan to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.
The tourism board recently announced plans to withdraw 110 million yuan from the budget over the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists to return.

To make health and wellness a key tourism highlight in Singapore, the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) launched a public consultation on November 23, 2022, to develop a health and wellness destination along the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Liling, Executive Director of the Sports and Wellness Tourism Division of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put health first in all considerations.

Developing a health and wellness destination in Marina South, which already boasts Gardens by the Bay and the Marina Barrage, could contribute to Singapore's tourism and economy by encouraging visitors to spend and stay longer in the city-state.
Chen Boon Huan, CEO of Singapore Tourism Board, said that health and wellness will become an important part of Singapore's tourism products in the next few years.
the COVID-19 pandemic has increased public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Office has been promoting healthy living projects to the local public and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) held the first Health and Wellness Festival, offering more than 130 health and wellness activities and experiences to the public.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences to visitors.

Besides the newly opened Singapore Children's Museum, Gardens by the Bay's Cloud Forest, Central Market at St. Tereasa, ArtScience Museum's new "Explore New Frontiers" gallery and Night Safari's outdoor theater, the Tourism Board will support the development and update of projects such as the Wildlife Reserves Singapore's Jurong Bird Park, making Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will formulate industry standards for meetings, exhibitions and incentive tourism sustainable development within 2023, and focus on improving waste treatment and carbon emissions in two aspects, further optimizing the tourism environment.
The recovery of Singapore's tourism industry is accelerating the recovery of the aviation industry.

According to the data, as of December 18, 2022, Changi Airport passenger flow has recovered strongly, with daily passengers reaching 150,000, weekly passengers reaching 1 million, which is about 75% of pre-pandemic levels, and the number of employees in the aviation industry has also recovered to about 90% of pre-pandemic levels.

According to the data, Singapore received 23.6 million tourists from January to October 2022, which is equivalent to 42% of the pre-epidemic period. The number of flights was 1.7 million, which is 53% of the pre-epidemic period.
The tourism industry is recovering quickly, which has also driven the recovery of the accommodation, transportation, catering and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and the tourism industry have high expectations for the Chinese market.

According to Ms. Koh Su Dan, Assistant Director of the International Division of the Singapore Tourism Board, a survey conducted by a Chinese travel platform showed that Singapore's safety index ranks among the top three in the world, which is one of the reasons why Chinese tourists love Singapore.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, China sent about 3.6 million people to Singapore for travel and vacation each year.
With China’s relaxation of border policies, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists will recover to one-third to one-half of 2019.
Koh Su Dan pointed out that in the future, the tourism bureau will closely follow the further release of China's outbound travel policy signals to respond to the changes in tourist demand.

Singapore Tourism Board will not only strengthen partnership with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies, but also actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists in response to the new trends of Chinese outbound tourism.

Looking forward to the tourism market in 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is confident that the recovery of the tourism industry will be faster than expected as long as the global economy does not show a significant downturn that affects public income and there are no new large-scale epidemics.

Chongyang Q&A - How to view the US non-farm employment data in January, which is much higher than expected, and future trends - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Q: How does Reyong Investment view the US January non-farm payroll data, which is much higher than expected, and the future trend?

A: On February 3, the US Department of Labor released the non-farm employment data for January 2023, with non-farm employment increasing by 51.70 million, significantly higher than the market expectation of 18.90 million; the unemployment rate fell to 3.4%, the lowest in nearly 50 years; hourly wages increased by 4.4% year-on-year and 0.3%

From the total, this data has many one-time and technical factors that interfere, such as the adjustment of the survey and statistical behavior, the update of the seasonal adjustment factor, and there may be some adjustments in the future (referring to the revision of the non-agricultural employment from 504,000 to 364,000 in January 2022), and the non-agricultural employment

From the perspective of structure, the impact of layoffs in high-tech enterprises is still relatively low; the number of new jobs in high-contact service industries such as leisure hotels, education, and healthcare has increased significantly, and data shows that the labor force gap in the service industry still exists.

With the strong rebound in the similarly unexpectedly robust services PMI, job openings and labor market data, we judge that the U.S. services sector is on the cusp of a rapid recovery after extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that the tightening of the U.S. labor market supply and demand cannot be improved without a recession.

The U.S. labor market currently has a supply gap of more than 5 million, and the labor force participation rate is rising slowly, especially the labor force participation rate of 25-54 years old is close to the pre-epidemic high.
In addition, the strong consumer demand will further delay the impact of tightening policies on the labor market due to the strong growth of US residents' excess savings and consumer credit.
The US labor market will remain tight in 2023, which will be the bottom line of the US economy.
With interest rates close to ending their rise and inflation expectations fluctuating, we are not optimistic about the continued decline in wage growth.
Before the release of the data, the US stock, bond and currency market overestimated the Fed's tightening path.

With the continued improvement in inflation data, the Fed has maintained the balance of keeping market inflation expectations fragile while shortening the steps of rate hikes, but the market has ignored the Fed's hawkish statements and not only expects the rate hikes to stop ahead of schedule, but also expects two rate cuts at the end of the year.

Given the tight labor market and the uncertainty of the impact of contractionary policies, we believe that the Fed's guidance at the end of the year to raise interest rates is relatively reasonable, and the extreme market expectations and trading congestion may cause some damage to the market.

However, the persistent growth of wages cannot change the trend of rapid decline of current inflation, and the persistent growth of wages will only form a bottom for future inflation data, and the current market expectation is difficult to refute. After the release of the next inflation data, the market may enter a new round of game.
