"Fund E-account" is coming: CSRC authorizes development of investors' unified collection and inquiry of all funds - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Economic Observer, Chen Jian, reporter: Is it difficult to collect account information due to the complexity of the fund purchase channel?
do you always forget the "treasure box"?
The basic masses' problems will be solved.
On February 10, the CSRC announced that the "Fund E-account" app was available for download and public testing in various mobile app stores.

According to the introduction, "Fund E-Account" is a "one-stop" inquiry service for individual investors to provide public fund account and share information, which aims to solve the pain points of the industry service that the majority of small and medium investors forget their accounts and inquire with difficulty.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there are 156 public fund management companies in China, managing funds of about 2.6 trillion yuan; there are 167 public fund registration institutions and 411 public fund sales institutions.
Each registration authority has its own account system, which lacks a unified industry query channel.

According to some industry insiders, by the end of 2021, the number of investors in China's fund market exceeded 72 million, which means that half of the country's population has invested in fund products.

Previously, investors had to query purchase situations through different sales channels, but through "Fund E-Account", they can query purchase situations through all sales channels, and the holding situation of the fund is clear at a glance.
What is the "Fund E-Account" App?

According to the relevant documents, the "Fund E-Account" APP is a mobile application developed and constructed with the approval of the CSRC for the fund industry gateway, which can provide investors with a one-stop query for the holding of offshore shareholdings of public fund products in the entire market.

Investors can conveniently and quickly learn about their holdings of the offshore units of public mutual funds managed by fund management companies through the "Fund E-Account", and comprehensively improve the efficiency of inquiries.

Specifically, the information that investors can obtain through the “Fund E-account” includes the information of fund accounts opened by fund management companies in the public offering of funds in the whole market, the information of trading accounts opened by sales institutions of public offering funds, and the holding situation of the products such as the collective asset management plan that does not have the limit of 200 investors for the investors who hold the public offering securities investment funds and the investment funds managed by the

Liu Yiqian, the business manager of Shanghai Securities and Funds Evaluation Research Center, told the Economic Observer that investors can use the "Fund E-Account" App to know all their off-exchange public fund holdings at one time, to find their "forgotten assets", and more importantly, to collect all the account information of the consolidated fund investment, to help investors better, more timely, accurate and complete understand their investment situation,
How do I register?

The reporter noticed that the "Fund E-account" App has been listed in Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo and other mobile phone application stores, but the App is still in the public test phase, and registration requires filling in the invitation code, which can be obtained by investors by contacting the fund manager of the fund they hold.

A staff member of a large public fund in Shanghai provided a six-digit invitation code to a reporter from Economic Observer and said, "The APP is in the trial operation stage. China Clearing provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager, and investors can get them by calling. We will provide them.
After the trial run is over, users will be able to register without an invitation code.

The reporter registered and completed the inquiry according to the download and use instructions of the "Fund E-Account" related documents published on the website of the CSRC, which took only a few minutes. The whole process was mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real-name authentication, fund account binding, and public fund inquiry.

After completing the real name authentication, click the “Asset” fund binding button, and all fund products purchased by the reporter through various fund sales platforms will be displayed in the binding options list (can be bound to the account), and after completing the binding, the reporter can directly see the total assets of the invested funds and can start using the query function.
It should be noted that "Fund E-accounts" only provide query services for investors and cannot redeem or purchase.
The date of the data displayed in "Fund E Account" is generally three trading days before the date on which the user inquires (T day).

For example, when you open the "Fund E-account" on February 10, the total assets, fund shares, and net asset value displayed on the asset page correspond to the date three trading days before that day, i.e., February 7.

French Labor Union Calls for Another Mass Rally Against Government Pension Reform
On Saturday (February 11), French unions called for a nationwide mobilization against the government's pension reform bill, calling on the public to take to the streets to express their views.
This is the fourth day of social action against the government's pension reform bill.
How many people respond to the call for a rally could affect what the union group does next.
This is the fourth nationwide mobilization in a month by the eight major French trade union confederations, and the first time that the demonstration has been scheduled for a Saturday.
Given that Saturday is a public holiday for most French people, who do not have to choose between taking part in protests or strikes, the unions hope that today's gathering will attract more people.

Neither the bus and subway systems nor the public rail companies have called for a strike, so the bus and subway systems should be able to operate normally, allowing citizens to take the bus or subway to the rally site, and people in areas where schools are about to start winter vacation can travel normally.
Union groups hope for more than a million to attend the rally, while police expect a national turnout of between 600,000 and 800,000, with 90,000 to 120,000 in Paris.

Since the start of the protest against the government's pension reform plan, although polls show that most French people do not support the measure to delay the statutory retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people who actually participate in the demonstrations has gradually decreased.
The first strike and protest on January 31st gathered 12.7 to 25 million people across the country.
The number of protesters has shrunk from 7.57 million to between 2 million and 2 million.
The pension reform plan is currently under discussion in the French National Assembly.
The opposition parties, especially the left-wing opposition parties, submitted numerous amendments, which slowed down the review process.
The debate between the pro- and anti-government factions is becoming increasingly sharp.

A member of the French left-wing party, which refuses to give in, posted a picture of himself on social media standing on a balloon with the face of the Labour Minister printed on it, sparking protests from the ruling party.
The National Assembly Speaker finally announced a 15-day ban on the lawmaker from participating in the National Assembly activities as a punishment for such behavior.
Despite the largest social movement in France in the past 20 years, the government has so far made only minor adjustments to the bill and no major concessions.
The union is preparing to launch another protest next Thursday, March 7, when the reform bill is sent to the Senate for discussion, and plans to organize a demonstration.

Last East German Communist Leader Dies
The successor of the East German Communist Party reported in a statement, "Hans Modrow left us yesterday at the age of 95.
Therefore, our party has lost an important leader.
On Nov. 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall was opened, ending 28 years of separation between East and West Berlin, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democracy.
At the time, the Communist leaders were forced to resign because of the protests in East Germany demanding democracy and freedom.
Gorbachev, after coming to power in the Soviet Union, also demanded reforms in Eastern Europe.
On March 18, 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election results forced him to resign as prime minister.
Despite Mobutu's reforms, opponents accused him of trying to delay the political changes and unification scheduled for October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to reshape rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Modi was convicted of electoral malpractice in the municipal elections of May 1989, but was not imprisoned.
The charges were said to be politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German Parliament and was a Member of the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
Modro sees himself as a reformer and wants to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters he did not want to return to the old East Germany but said it should be recognized for its achievements.
Modrzejewski was born in 1928 in the German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica in Poland) and trained as a mechanic.
During World War II, he was a youth firefighter leader and a member of the Volkssturm, a Nazi paramilitary organization that recruited men aged 16 to 60 to fight in the final battles.
At 17, Modro was captured by the Soviet army and taken to the Soviet Union, where he took anti-fascist courses and became a staunch communist.
In 1949, the year the GDR was founded, he returned to his homeland and found a job as a mechanic while continuing to study social sciences and economics and earning a doctorate.

Modrow was a functionary of the Free German Youth, a group to which almost all East German young people belonged, and from 1973 to 1989 he rose through the ranks of the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED) to become chairman of the Dresden district party.
He also served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, assuming the highest state office.
Iran marks revolution anniversary, hackers support protests by interrupting president's TV speech
Iran's Islamic Republic marked 44 years of the Islamic Revolution on Saturday with an official rally, but anti-government hackers briefly disrupted President Hassan Rouhani's televised speech.

A live stream of President Trump's televised speech was interrupted by about a minute on the internet, with a group of Iranian hackers' logo appearing on the screen, whose name is "Edalat Ali" (Ali's Justice).
There was also a voice shouting "Death to the Islamic Republic."
Reuters reported today that hackers interrupted the state television's report on the anniversary of the revolution in Iran.

Iran's hard-line government faces its biggest challenge in 44 years of the Islamic Republic as young protesters demand they step down, but Rouhani still calls on "deceived youth" to repent so they can be pardoned by Iran's supreme leader.
Mahsa Amini, 22, died in custody of Iran's morality police in September, sparking nationwide protests in the country.
The Iranian security forces' deadly crackdown on protests is one of the biggest challenges the Islamic Republic has faced since the 1979 revolution overthrew a 2,500-year-old monarchy.

As part of the anniversary of the revolution, Iranian authorities released hunger-striking dissident Farhad Meysami and Iranian-French scholar Fariba Adelkhah, who had been detained for expressing different opinions, on Friday.
Earlier, supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued a pardon that included some prisoners arrested in recent anti-government protests.
According to the human rights organization HRANA, as of Friday, 528 protesters have been killed, including 71 minors.
The report said 70 government security personnel were also killed.
It is believed that 19,763 protesters were arrested.
Iranian leaders and state media have been urging people to turn out at Friday's rally to vote in favor of or against the protests and the government.
On Friday night, the anniversary of the Iranian revolution, state media showed fireworks as part of government-sponsored celebrations, with people shouting "Allahu Akbar!"
(God is the greatest!)”
But at the rally, many people were shouting "Death to the dictator!
"And the death of the Islamic Republic on social media."
On Saturday, the government television broadcast live footage of official rallies in various provinces.
In Tehran, as part of the official celebrations, Iranian-made anti-ballistic missiles, drones, anti-submarine cruisers and other military equipment were displayed.
President Laxalt's speech was often interrupted by the "Death to America" slogan - a signature slogan at the state convention.
The crowd also shouted, "Death to Israel."

Adelkhah, who has been in jail since 2019, is one of seven French nationals held in Iran, a factor that has contributed to the deterioration in relations between Paris and Tehran in recent months, Reuters said.
She was sentenced to five years in prison in 2020 on charges of endangering national security.
They later put her under house arrest, but in January she was back in jail.
Adelkhah denies the charges.
Mesaymi was released a week ago, supporters warned he was at risk of death due to his hunger strike.
He was arrested in 2018 for protesting the mandatory wearing of headscarves.
The French Foreign Ministry called for Adelkhah's release on Friday, "including the possibility of returning to France if she wishes."
The balloon incident brightened the eyes of the United States?
Strengthening restrictions on technology exports to China
According to the Wall Street Journal today, the United States is preparing to further tighten its export of technology to China after the balloon incident.
The recent balloon incidents highlight the national security threat posed by China and will bolster efforts to strengthen U.S. technological protection, current and former security officials said.
The United States said the balloon carried antennas and sensors for information collection and communication.
"It's a very, very big deal," said Martijn Rasser, a former senior CIA official who is now a fellow at the Center for a New American Security in Washington.
"This is clearly a case of pouring oil on the fire, supporting the hardline stance against China."

White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said Thursday that the administration is also considering taking broader actions to expose and counter China's broader surveillance activities, which pose a threat to our national security and that of our allies and partners.
U.S. officials said they have notified more than 30 governments about the balloon incidents, underscoring the importance of international coordination to address the Chinese threat.

Emily Benson, a senior researcher at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, said that in addition to the actions of the Biden administration, the newly established US-China Strategic Competition Task Force of the US House of Representatives may also exert pressure on the United States to take more severe measures to slow down China's development.
She said members of Congress would feel increasing pressure to take a harder line, which could in turn force the White House to do the same.
The Wall Street Journal said that many people who advocate stricter export control are also promoting the expansion of the control scope, and include artificial intelligence and other industries.
The U.S. government is also working on a plan to review outbound investment for potential threats to national security from China.
Analysts say the White House could face calls to speed up the plan.
The story of the 921 earthquake relief and recovery
Rescue teams from dozens of countries have been working around the clock in the rubble of thousands of destroyed buildings since the powerful quake hit Turkey and neighboring Syria.
In the cold, they often called for quiet, because they were straining to hear any sign of life from the rubble of broken concrete.
According to Reuters today, two more women were rescued from the rubble of the earthquake after surviving for several days.
But the death toll from the quake has risen to 24,150.
Turkey has 20,665 deaths, Syria has more than 3,500.

The 7.8-magnitude quake that struck on Monday, followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the 2011 Japan earthquake and tsunami and approaching the 2003 Bam earthquake in Iran, which killed 31,000 people.
A similar strong earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 killed more than 17,000 people.
Two women were trapped for 122 hours after the deadliest earthquake in the region in 20 years, Turkish officials said Saturday, as rescuers pulled them from the rubble of collapsed buildings.
Another injured man, 55-year-old Masallah Cicek, was pulled from the rubble of a collapsed building in the southeastern Turkish city of Diyarbakir.
In the cold, rescuers often call for quiet, as they strain to hear any sign of life amid the rubble of broken concrete.
In Samandag, Turkey, rescuers huddled under a concrete slab, whispering "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they carefully reached into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
He opened his eyes and was wrapped in a warming blanket and carried to a field hospital.
Video images showed rescuers also carrying his mother, who was dazed and disoriented on the deck, pale but conscious.
Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters overnight that 67 people were rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours, and 31,000 rescue personnel were mobilized in the disaster area.
He said about 80,000 people were being treated in hospitals and 1.05 million were homeless and crammed into temporary shelters.
With many people lacking food in the harsh winter conditions, the public is increasingly questioning the leaders' response to the disaster.
Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo, state media reported, in what was said to be his first visit to a quake-hit area since the disaster.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said its stocks in rebel-held northwestern Syria were running out because the conflict had made aid work more complicated.
On Friday, Erdogan visited the Turkish province of Adiyaman, where he admitted that the government's response had not been quick enough.
Opponents have seized on the issue to attack Erdogan, who is seeking re-election in a vote on May 14 but may delay it because of the disaster.
Reuters said that anger over the delay in providing aid and launching rescue work could affect the election.
Even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the toughest challenge to Erdogan's rule in two decades.
Ertadan called for unity and condemned what he called "negative campaigns" for political purposes.
Kemal Kilicdaroglu, the leader of Turkey's main opposition party, criticized the government's response.
"The earthquake was big, but what was worse was the lack of coordination, lack of planning and inability," critics said.

What is the object that was shot down in the sky of Alaska?
And what a twist(ed) ending!
The US military used its most advanced stealthy gas-spraying fighter, the F-22, to shoot down an unidentified object flying in US airspace over Alaska on Friday afternoon, the Pentagon said.
The crash site is about 10 miles from the Alaska coast.
This is the second time in less than a week that the U.S. military has shot down an unidentified flying object.
A Chinese spy balloon floated in the skies over the US East Coast for several days before being shot down off the coast of South Carolina last Saturday.

The second object, which was shot down late Thursday, entered U.S. airspace for the first time that evening and was tracked by the U.S. military as it moved through the skies over northeastern Alaska at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), about the size of a small car, and much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier.
The Pentagon also believes there is no evidence that this object is controllable.

John Cooper, the National Security Council's strategic communications coordinator, said Friday that while the specific shape of the object flying in the sky was unclear, it "poses a reasonable threat to the safety of civilian aircraft."
Kobe said the object was different from the spy balloon found over the United States, which had a payload hanging from it.
"We call it an object because that's the best description we can give it," Bryant said.
Biden consulted with the Pentagon before ordering the strike on the object, and he made the decision "very carefully," Coburn added.
The official description of this object by the US authorities can be summarized as follows: size of a small car, no control stick, no suspension, and a flight altitude of about 10,000 meters.
But they don't answer basic questions like what is this object, what country does it belong to, what is it doing.
Many online analyses and speculations believe that this may be another Chinese balloon.

It may have come from China, like the spy balloon that invaded American airspace and the Chinese balloon that floated over Latin America, both of which were performing some kind of mission in different locations.
Some have even linked the Alaska object to UFOs.
The report from Newsweek quotes former U.S. Rep. Peter Meijer, who tweeted Friday, "I hope this UFO is a spy balloon and not a legitimate UFO."
"The joke of comparing alien spacecraft to weather balloons is a bit of a stretch, but it's not worth starting a galactic war over," Messier said.
MJ tweeted this out shortly after Kobe proved that Alaska was not immune to falling objects.
Newsweek reports that it's not just Mejia who doubts the object is a UFO.

Republican Rep. Tim Burchett of Tennessee criticized the government's handling of the information last month and called on the Office of the Director of National Intelligence to release a report on UFOs.

Reading the book, you may recall the quarrelsome couple next door, the friend whose marriage has gone stale, and the relationships that have gone awry.

That’s why I don’t recommend reading it, from the perspective of reviewing, the penmanship and plot of this book are tasteless, unless your life is full of ups and downs or you live in a candy castle, otherwise, reading it will make you feel that it is neither strange nor interesting.

And on a deeper level, the vignettes don't illuminate or expand the characters' thoughts or perspectives (unlike in Marquez's "Love in the Time of Cholera"), and they don't explore questions like what kind of mistakes led to the failure of their love?
What are the reasons for the protagonist's marital breakdown?
So I don't recommend reading this book, whether you read it or not, it doesn't matter.
The author's ideas are more often expressed through techniques and style than through plot, which is why the reading experience is less satisfying.

A primer on internet finance

This book is shallow, can be said to be a textbook, can help everyone quickly understand the full picture of Internet finance, but to understand in depth, you still have to go by the book and dig it yourself.

Chen’s book was published earlier, and it didn’t mention the later battle between Alipay and WeChat Pay for user habits, which supplemented the content. Today, the market share of third-party payment is probably not as small as what the book said.
Nowadays, many people go out to eat and only need to bring their phones, and merchants have abandoned UnionPay because of high bank turnover.

But I am very grateful to the author for writing this introductory book. It is clear that the author has at least many years of financial observation experience and is very familiar with the history of financial development in the country and abroad, so he can write such popular and easy-to-understand content.
It's easy to write high-flown prose, but it's hard to write prose that's clear and easy to understand.
I love you, and I want you to know!
The first determinant of a person's job satisfaction is not the salary, but whether he or she is respected and recognized in the workplace.
According to Maslow's hierarchy of needs, once basic survival needs are met, the most pressing need is for psychological needs to be met - to be understood, affirmed and recognized.
Indeed, for the Chinese, most of them are “I love you in my heart”, even if they have love, gratitude and praise, they will keep it in their heart and will not say it out loud.
The author identifies five love languages: words of affirmation, quality time, acts of service, receiving gifts, and physical touch.

I think it's more important that you know what the five languages of appreciation are, but that you can use them at any time, in any place, to appreciate the people in your life, whether they're family members, friends or colleagues.
The more intimate you are with someone, the more you need to praise and thank them, so that your life becomes more beautiful.
If companies learn to praise, they can also retain talent to a certain extent and reduce turnover.
Thank you for bringing us the wonderful ideas and world from abroad.

Because of the cultural background of the East and the West, there are differences between languages, and if there is an opportunity to see the original version of the author, it will be more rewarding.

the worst shopping experience in history

My wife dropped her phone at night on September 23rd, so I impulsively ordered an 8p from Amazon Malaysia, which was in stock but not sold by Amazon (I was secretly happy), because non-sold items are shipped more slowly, the system showed that the latest delivery date would be September 27th.

My wife doesn’t have a phone and it’s hard for her to live, so she called me at 6:30 in the morning the next day to think about it. After going to Jingdong, I saw that there was 256G available for same-day delivery, so I had to order it immediately.
I just bought a new one and I'm thinking about canceling my Amazon order right away.

Because the order was placed at night, it is impossible to receive the express delivery in the middle of the night, and at 7:30 in the morning, I called the customer service to request to cancel the order, and the customer service answered that it had been canceled and to wait for the text message notification.

Well, I just patiently waited, and when I checked my phone at noon, the order was still in the status of not shipped, so I immediately contacted customer service to request them to cancel the order, and the customer service replied that they had already operated OK.

At 3pm I checked my phone and the order was still there, I couldn't do anything but contact customer service again to confirm that I had called them for the third time and asked them to cancel the order and tell the seller not to ship it!

The customer service contacted the seller on my request and told me that the seller was not familiar with the system and had to wait until he was familiar with the system to operate the cancellation of the order.
But please be assured that the seller already knows and will not ship.
When I looked at the order on Monday, I was speechless to see that it had already been shipped.
I couldn't contact the seller directly, so I had to call customer service again.
I can't even describe what happened next, basically I said one thing and the customer service had to do the next step.
Your order is still in the status of delivery refusal, and we are preparing to send it again!
Amazon won't be proactive in pursuing this, will they?
The brokerage company doesn't care as long as they get paid.
In summary, I will never pay in advance for large items again, it's too troublesome.
